tupa’un cia tama nak ngan tu Biung.
My dad’s name is Biung.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我爸爸的名字是Biung。

tupa’un cia tina nak ngan tu Aping.
My mother’s name is Aping.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我媽媽的名字是Aping。

mac’an nak haip pa qamisan.
I am 10 years old.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我今年10歲。

heza nak tatinin masitoqas, tupa’un tu Lukus, mac’an qan tas’a ka qamisan cia haip
I have a brother, his name is Lukus, he is 11 years old.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我有一個哥哥，他叫Lukus，他今年11歲。

maszang nam ma kaku’ dangian masipul.
We study in the same school.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我們在同一間學校讀書。

asa amin cam tusauc.
Both my brother and I like to sing.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我們都喜歡唱歌。

madu cak taldanav maca pal’u’un na, muskun cam tastulumaq taldanav.
I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我喜歡游泳，如果放假的時候，我們全家會一起去游泳。

asa cak pasaqal kaviaz, maqtu cam muskun tusauc taldanav.
I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我喜歡認識朋友，我們可以一起唱歌和游泳。

uva’az cak Bunun.
I am an Bunun child.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我是布農族的小孩。

han nam tamazu’an na lumaq.
Our family lives in tamazu’an.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我們家住在地利。

hahima cam tastulumaq.
There are five people in our family.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我們一家共有五個人。

heza cam tatau tec’an.
There are three brothers and sisters in our family.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我們有三個兄弟姊妹。

muskun cam tastulumaq miqumic.
I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我們一家人生活在一起。

madaqvas sa tama nak, kisacu’ a tama nak.
My father is tall and he is a policeman.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我的爸爸很高，我的爸爸是警察。

makuis sa tina nak, ising nga tina nak.
My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我的媽媽很瘦，我的媽媽是醫生。

malasbunun na tama nam han lumaq bazbaz zami.
My father speaks the Bunun language with us at home.
我的名字是Tiang。: 爸爸在家會和我們說族語。

munhan cam acang maca pal’u’un.
We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我們暑假都會回部落。

muskun cak masitoqas nak madamu opop.
My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我和兄姊會一起抓青蛙。

madedaz cak inak tastulumaq.
I like our family very much.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我很喜歡我的家人。

dusa’ cak tina nak munata haip paqaqenan.
I went out with my mother today.
我的名字是Tiang。: 今天我和媽媽兩個人出去玩。

masanglav va diqanin, nitu makazhav nitu maklang, makazhav va luvluv.
The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.
我的名字是Tiang。: 白天的天空很藍，天氣不冷也不熱，風很涼爽。

ihan cam nastu ismut mama’un pang, sanvali’an na hubung siklangan.
We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我們在草地上吃著麵包，陽光灑在身上，非常溫暖。

minaun tongquvali, matudangqac ca diqanin.
In the afternoon, the sky turned red.
我的名字是Tiang。: 下午，天空變紅了。

macingav cak tina tu “makuacuna madangqac ca diqanin.”
I asked my mother why the sky is red.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我問媽媽，為甚麼天空是紅色的。

tupa ka tina tu “nalauqa luvluvan.”
Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.
我的名字是Tiang。: 媽媽說，可能是颱風要來了。

sanavan uka luhum han diqanin, minsumain na bintoqan.
There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.
我的名字是Tiang。: 晚上天上沒有雲，星星出來了。

namudanin cam mulumaq.
We were going home too.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我們也要回家了。

ihan mulumaq tu dan, tupaun zaku ka bintoqan tu.
On the way home, I made a wish with the stars,
我的名字是Tiang。: 在回家的路上，我跟星星許願，

maqtu’ang uka’ a luvluv minsuma, opa asang cak moqnang munata paqaqenan.
I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.
我的名字是Tiang。: 希望颱風不要來，因為，我還想再出去玩。

han nak ka kaku’ ngalan lumaq nam, daqdaqqanin cak tan’anak munhan kaku’, tan’anak amin mulumaq.
My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我的學校在我們家旁邊，我天天走路去學校，也走路回家。

ni nam ma kaku’ madaing, nitu madia’ a pantu’, amin cam pasaqal.
Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我們學校不大，沒有很多學生，大家互相認識。

amin na uvava’az si’anpuk han deseq, muskun pismali’, muskun pababazbaz.
All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.
我的名字是Tiang。: 所有小朋友會聚在操場，一起玩球、一起聊天。

muskun amin na sinsi’ zami paqaqenan, maszang nga kaku’ tastulumaq.
The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.
我的名字是Tiang。: 老師們也會和我們一起玩，學校像個大家庭。

daqdaqqanin cam ma’asik, asatu piningzavun na dangi’an ma’asik.
We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我們每天都要打掃，大家要把教室打掃乾淨。

heza maqesqes tongkul, heza ma’asik.
Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.
我的名字是Tiang。: 有些人去擦窗戶，有些人去掃地。

asikun amin zami ka caikuciaku ki kaku’, paqusil cam kukuza, daqdaqqanin na kaku’ maningzav.
We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我們還會打掃學校的各個角落，大家分工合作，學校每天都很乾淨。

munhan cak takna acang tantungu han qudasnanaz.
Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.
我的名字是Tiang。: 昨天我去部落拜訪爺爺。

talmadin cam nitu pasadu, miliskin cak cia.
We haven’t seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我們很久沒有見面了，我很想念他。

sadu ka qudasnanaz zaku, usun cak pa’ka’un salitung, paqu’ ucia’.
As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat papaya and drink tea.
我的名字是Tiang。: 爺爺一看到我，就請我吃木瓜，請我喝茶。

madavuc ca sincuaz qudasnanaz salitung, macial ko’nun.
The papaya grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.
我的名字是Tiang。: 爺爺種的木瓜很甜，真的很好吃。

asa amin cak ucia’ i qudasnanaz, macial amin qu’dan.
I also like grandpa’s tea, it’s tasted good too.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我也喜歡爺爺的茶，也很好喝。

matu tongquvali ka, muskun cak qudasno’az pit’ia petutongquvali.
At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.
我的名字是Tiang。: 中午的時候，我和奶奶一起煮午餐。

mahanat ta qudasno’az mahancum tu petutongquvali, heza iskan, tulkuk, bahat, hezang qazuqazu’.
Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.
我的名字是Tiang。: 奶奶煮了很豐盛的午餐，有魚、有雞、有南瓜、還有蝸牛。

mina’unin tongquvali, munhan cam pisanglavan matinguc sanglav.
After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.
我的名字是Tiang。: 吃完午餐後，我們去菜園摘菜。

siza’ a qudasno’az madia hutan, tai cin tilkum, napa’adas zaku mulumaq.
Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.
我的名字是Tiang。: 奶奶拿了很多地瓜、芋頭和蕗蕎給我，要我帶回家。

namudanin cak, tupaun zaku nai tu namoqnang cak mun’iti sadu mu’u.
I said goodbye to them and said I’d see them next time.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我要離開了，我對他們說下次再來看你們。

adasun cam haip sinsi’ munhan sadu’an tesmumut, tidelaz cam han hilav mabaliv kipu’.
Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.
我的名字是Tiang。: 今天老師帶我們去動物園，我們在門口排隊買票。

mukunbu’in tupaka sinsi’ tu “maqa han tanangaus aiza ka loqe, maqa han tanhiku’ aiza ka ivut, anaka sadu.
After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back
我的名字是Tiang。: so you can visit them yourself.""
https://web.klokah.tw/text/sound/34817/5: 進入動物園後，老師說:「前面是鳥類，後面是蛇類，大家自己參觀。」

mapising cak ivut, pangqa ni cak sadu ivut.
I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我會怕蛇，所以我不看蛇類。

sadu cak madia loqe’, ihan nai daza’ lukic kusbabai, usadu’an cak toqu ihan kunbu tuszoq lukic masabaq.
I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我看到了很多鳥，他們在樹上飛來飛去，我看到貓頭鷹在樹洞裡睡覺。

maqa kumbu di ka heza zo, uma’ cin kuknav, niang cak qabas senidu naidi, manaskal cak haip mun’iti sadu.
There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.
我的名字是Tiang。: 這裡面有象、馬和老虎，我從前沒有看過這些動物，今天看到了真的很開心。

madia nak ka sinlasasing na pasadu zaku tamatina.
I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我拍了很多照片，給爸爸媽媽看。

maqe moqnin na taskun cak tamatina nak mun’iti.
Next time I will come with my parents.
我的名字是Tiang。: 下次要跟我的爸爸媽媽一起來。

maqe pal’un haipi, dusa’ cak toqas nak munhan Taitu’ tantungu han pantama’un nam.
This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.
我的名字是Tiang。: 這個假日，我和姊姊去台東拜訪我們的叔叔。

minihan cam Mihavaz tundaza’ kisia’ munhan Taitu’.
We took the train from Shuili to Taitung.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我們從水里搭火車去臺東。

kahanin cam Taitu’, ma’unting nga pantama’un lehleh munhan pandu’anlehleh anpasdu zami.
When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我們到了台東，叔叔開車來車站接我們。

maqa pandu’anlehleh ka nitu daqvisan ni lumaq pantama’un, mahiv ma’unting lehleh ka ka’ita’in.
The station is not far from my uncle’s house, and it’s just a short drive away.
我的名字是Tiang。: 車站離叔叔家沒有很遠，開車一下子就到了。

heza madaing sepukan sinepuk han ngalan lumaq pantama’un, tincuzinsa’ cam mun’ita.
There is a big ranch near my uncle’s house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.
我的名字是Tiang。: 叔叔家附近有個很大的牧場，我們一起騎腳踏車去那裡。

han sepukan sinepuk, dasun cam pantama’un nam paka’un sidi tundaza’ uma’.
In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.
我的名字是Tiang。: 在牧場，叔叔帶我們餵羊和騎馬。

sanavan’in, muskun cam munhan maci’ ma’un.
In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.
我的名字是Tiang。: 到了晚上，我們一起去市區吃飯。

madia lehleh han maci’, pangqa tundaza’ cam utuvai’ mun’ita’.
There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.
我的名字是Tiang。: 市區車子很多，所以我們騎摩托車去那裡。

matu namudanin na, uka a utuvai’ tangqai’iu’un bunun, muazin cam tunbasu’ mudan.
When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.
我的名字是Tiang。: 要離開的時候，摩托車不見被人偷了，我們只好搭公車離開。

hanin cam lopaku Nantu’, nitu qanciap tu kinu’ananin opa ka utuvai’ i pantama’un.
Now that we are back in Nantu, I don’t know if my uncle’s motorcycle has been found.
我的名字是Tiang。: 現在我們回到南投了，不知道叔叔的摩托車找到了沒有。

ihan nam tamazu’an na lumaq tu uva’azng, pantu’in na mulusqu’ cam munhan Taiciu’, civung ihan baq miqumic.
When we were young, our family lived in tamazu’an. After I started school, we moved to Taichung and have been living in the city ever since.
我的名字是Tiang。: 小時候我們家住在地利，上學以後，我們就搬到了台中，一直在都市裡生活。

munhanin pantu’daing, masipul cak pali’unin iniqumican takisilazan, tu’ipin cak maqanciap icia takitaivang di vevivevi sidoq tu iniqumican.
After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.
我的名字是Tiang。: 上了大學以後，我修了一堂關於原住民文化的課程，瞭解到臺灣原住民族有各式各樣豐富的文化。

pangqa, matu pal’u’un haip qamisan, dusa cak ki masitoqas nak munhan acang macingav madadengaz, na’asa maqanciap anak’anak sidoq tu iniqumican.
So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.
我的名字是Tiang。: 因此，今年暑假時，我和哥哥回到部落訪問老人家，想要瞭解自己族群的文化。

mavo’unin qamisan na qudas, qala talmintukang sadu’an.
The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.
我的名字是Tiang。: 老人家已經八十歲了，但是看起來還像中年人。

cingavan zami tu ma’aq qa qancepun cia qalinga, malmananu’ naip malasbunun, maqanciap amin malastolu cin malasput hezang malaslepun.
I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in Bunun, as well as Chinese, Hokkien and Japanese.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我們問他會哪些語言，他的布農說得很流利，也會說漢語及閩南語和日本話。

cingavan zami naip tudipin cam maqanciap, tikicang naip tu pinanamin malaslepun, matu kukuzakin na madia pasaqalan put cin tolu, pangqa madia cia ka qancepun qalinga.
I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, and he knows many Hokkien and Chinese at work, so he can speak so many languages.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我們問他才知道，原來他小時候就學過日本話，而他工作上認識許多閩南人和漢人，所以他會說這麼多語言。

matu macingav cam ma, madia cia madadengaz za palcicia takiqabas qanup tu snkukuza.
During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我們訪談的時候，老人家談論了許多關於狩獵的傳統知識。

qaltu ni cam amin itqal, qala kuci’an zami lingva lasasing, namaqtu uqna’un manengkal tan’a.
Although we could’t fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.
我的名字是Tiang。: 雖然我們沒有辦法完全聽懂，但是我們有用手機錄影，可以再仔細聆聽。

matu atikicang cam ma nitu saqal anak’anak sidoq tu iniqumican, miliskin anak’anak tu bunun na maz’avdaingaz.
When I was young, I didn’t understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.
我的名字是Tiang。: 小時候我們不瞭解自己族群的文化，對於自己是原住民有點不好意思。

malassaqalin na, miliskin anak’anak tu bunnun na, tutuza’ tu makisvevi, heza’an kainaskalan.
The more I know, the more I feel that being a Bunun is unique and something to be proud of.
我的名字是Tiang。: 少為瞭解愈之以後，愈覺得自己身為布農族人，是很獨特的，也很值得高興。

namulumaq ti a masinoba’ haip sanavan.
My younger brother is going home this evening.
我的名字是Tiang。: 今天傍晚，弟弟就要回家了。

dusa’ cak ki qudasno’az munhan babalivan mabaliv tulkuk, mahanat macial isqul ispaka’un masinoba’ sanavanin.
My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我和奶奶去市場買雞，準備煮好吃的晚餐給弟弟。

laqai’ cam balivansanglav madia’ a ma’u’uvul tu sanglav.
We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我們經過了菜攤，有好多新鮮的青菜。

mabaliv cam ingsai’, tanbungna’ cin tolacdangqac.
We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我們買了空心菜、山藥和胡蘿蔔。

tupa ka dinglan babalivan koko’un tu, “madavuc nak ka bunglai’ cin qalup, baliva tikic!”
The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: “My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!”
我的名字是Tiang。: 旁邊水果攤的老闆說:「我的鳳梨和桃子很甜。買一些吧!」

mabaliv cam munglai’ cin qalup.
We bought pineapples and peaches.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我們買了鳳梨和桃子。

laqai’ cam babalivan titi’, tupa ka babalivan tu, “maq su a balivun? madaing haip pa tulkuk ka malac tausaba cui tas’a.”
We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, “What do you want to buy? Today's chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD.”
我的名字是Tiang。: 我們經過了肉攤，老闆說:「你要買什麼?今天的雞又大又肥，一隻300元。」

maqlican na qudasno’az, macingav nip babalivan tu, “maqtu opa iasui’ tikic.”
Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.
我的名字是Tiang。: 奶奶覺得太貴了，問老闆可不可以便宜一點。

qala tupa ka babalivan tu, “iasui’in ’ni’in maqtu vanaqan.”
But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.
我的名字是Tiang。: 但老闆說已經很便宜，不能再減了。

tupa ka dingalan babalivan tu, “baliva iskan nak, manak ka iskan na madaing nga iasui.”
The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.
我的名字是Tiang。: 隔壁的老闆說，來買我的魚，我的魚又大又便宜。

kinuzin mabaliv cam tulkuk mabaliv amin iskan, mulumaq mahanat tas’a pangka isqul.
In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.
我的名字是Tiang。: 最後我們買了雞也買了魚，回家煮了一桌子的菜餚。

talmuntun mantatala, misdumdumin na diqanin.
After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.
我的名字是Tiang。: 等了好久，天已經黑了。

kalingva’ a masinoba tu, “mucqa nitu maqtu pal’u’un, nahanin monin islongqu’an mulumaq.”
The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn't take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.
我的名字是Tiang。: 弟弟打電話回來說，軍隊突然不能放假了，要下一個禮拜日才回來。

tupa ka qudasno’az tu, “madia’in na sinhanat, una’ui ka bunun muskun ma’un!”
Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let's eat together!
我的名字是Tiang。: 奶奶說已經煮了這麼多，叫大家一起來吃吧!

una’un zami ka tec’an cin kaviaz, muskun ma’un madia isqul tu sanavan.
We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我們邀請了親朋好友，一起來享用豐盛的晚餐。

heza nak uskunan tupa’un tu Kimat, qanglac naip minpungul madas qemangsut.
I have a classmate named Kimat, he often forgets to bring things.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我有一個同學叫Kimat，他常常忘記帶東西。

maca isnava’anin na, simul naip han uskunan inpicu’, isqeqesqes mintun patasan tu haqel.
During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.
我的名字是Tiang。: 上課的時候，他跟同學借鉛筆、橡皮擦或是筆記本。

matu miuc’an, mupusan, muti’un, pasimulanng zami naip qemangsut.
Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.
我的名字是Tiang。: 一次、兩次、三次，大家會借東西給他。

qala madikla’ nip pi, qanglac simul la nitu macoqes qemangsut.
But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.
我的名字是Tiang。: 但是他有個壞習慣，經常借了東西卻不還。

dungzavin amin cam nitu asa pasimul cai qemangsut.
In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.
我的名字是Tiang。: 變得大家都不想借他東西了。

heza tu tas’a qani’an muskun cam munata paqaqenan.
One day, we all went on an outing together.
我的名字是Tiang。: 有一天，我們大家一起去郊遊。

matu han dan na, asa ka Kimat munata, qala minpungul naip madas haqel isqesqes.
On the way, Kimat wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.
我的名字是Tiang。: 路途中，Kimat想上廁所，但他忘記帶衛生紙。

simul naip han uskunan haqel isqesqes, amin cam antalam tupa tu, uka amin nak inadas.
He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn’t bring them either.
我的名字是Tiang。: 他跟同學借衛生紙，可是大家都回他說，我也沒有帶耶。

tangicin na Kimat, mahau’ naip tupa tu “makua amu tuna amin nitu pasimul zaku haqel isqesqes!”
Kimat burst into tears. He said angrily, why don’t everyone lend me toilet paper!
我的名字是Tiang。: Kimat急的哭了出來。他生氣的說，為什麼大家都不借我衛生紙!

tupaun uskunan tu “opa ni asu anak madas, musutu maca pasimul su’u qemangsut, ni asu qanciap macoqes!”
The classmate told him, because you didn’t bring it yourself, and you wouldn’t return the things lent to you!
我的名字是Tiang。: 同學告訴他，因為你都不自己帶，而且借給你的東西，你都不會還!

munkaku’in laqbing, matingmut ta Kimat kahan kaku’, aminun Kimat ta sinimul cia qemangsut macoqes han uskunan.
The next day at school, Kimat arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.
我的名字是Tiang。: 隔天上學，Kimat很早就到學校了，Kimat把跟同學借的東西都還給同學們。

masihan na Kimat uskunan masumsum, tupa tu na’anakanakin naip madas qemangsut, miqumican uskunan pasimul cia qabas qemangsut.
Kimat apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.
我的名字是Tiang。: kimat向同學們道歉，並說他以後一定會自己帶東西，也謝謝同學們之前願意借他東西。

qaqanup nak ka tama.
My dad is a hunter of the tribe.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我的爸爸是獵人。

matu atikicang cak ka, dusa’ nai tama ki pantama’un sanavan munata’, madas nai via’ cin bucul.
When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我小的時候，爸爸和叔叔會在晚上出門，帶著獵刀和獵槍。

maqe tusqangin na, mama’ nai pinanaq tesmumut.
At daybreak, they returned with their prey.
我的名字是Tiang。: 天亮時，他們就會背著獵到的獵物回來。

mintun cia vanis, mintun cia haval, duanduan amin heza linas.
Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.
我的名字是Tiang。: 有時候是山豬、有時候是飛鼠，偶爾也會有雉雞。

matu soqesin mu’acang nanu pavazunin nai ka bahi’ nai, na’ispaqusil li tec’an.
They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.
我的名字是Tiang。: 他們會在進村前早將獵物分好，分享給族人。

qelic cak tupa ki tama tu “namalavi cak qanup.”
Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我每次都吵著爸爸，我要跟著去打獵。

tupa ka tama tu tudipi taldaingin asu kana adasunin asu.”
Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.
我的名字是Tiang。: 爸爸說等你長大了他再帶我一起去。

maqanciap amin na bananaz han acang mahaqu’ madamu tesmumut, maqanciap amin matas’i haqumucqut cin malqatu’ .
The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.
我的名字是Tiang。: 部落的男人也會用陷阱抓獵物，他們也會製作套索陷阱和石壓式陷阱。

maqanciap pa tama nak matas’i haqubantac, tupa ka tama tu “ishaqu’ epi linas, asa ata tu saqal dapan ni tesmumut, pihanun dan ni tesmumut ta haqu’.”
My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我的爸爸很會製作套索陷阱，爸爸說，這是用來捕抓雉雞的，我們要仔細觀察獵物的腳印，陷阱要放在獵物走的路上。

tis’uni asa mahiav malavi madadengaz qanup, lucbut cak pinanam malhaqu’, nitu talmadia’ tishaqu’an na haqu’ nak tesmumut.
In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.
我的名字是Tiang。: 為了可以趕快和大人一起去打獵，我每天練習製作陷阱，很快地我的陷阱就抓到獵物了。

sadu’an tama ka tupaun cak cia tu “namin’uni asu mamangan tu qaqanup.”
Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.
我的名字是Tiang。: 爸爸看到後他對我說我以後一定會是很厲害的獵人。

taldaingin cak lopaku, angqeli’an cak buculkahkah cin kus, malavi ki tama muskun qanup.
Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.
我的名字是Tiang。: 現在我長大了，我背起我的弓和箭矢，跟著爸爸一起去打獵。

mucoqesin na unna qenanup tesmumut ispaqusil tec’an.
When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.
我的名字是Tiang。: 回村時將獵到的獵物和族人們分享。

tupa ka tama tu “asa ata tu matumacqeng memadadengaz tu sintuqumic, maqtu ata madia’ bahi’.”
Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.
我的名字是Tiang。: 爸爸說，我們要感謝祖靈賜福，讓我們有很多獵物收穫。

pitu’ cak tuki’ haip kahan kaku’.
I arrived at school at seven today.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我今天七點到學校。

kitnga’in, minsumin na sinsi’, tupa ka lavivi’an tu “mindangkaza! masumsum!”
It’s time for class , the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: “Stand up! Salute!”
我的名字是Tiang。: 上課了，老師來了，班長說:「起立!敬禮!」

pidaingun zami tupa tu “miqumicang sinsi’.”
We said loudly, “Hi, teacher.”
我的名字是Tiang。: 我們大聲的說:「老師好。」

kinga’in isnava’an, isnava’an cam sinsi’ malasbunun masipul sipulun.
In class, the teacher taught us the Bunun language of numbers.
我的名字是Tiang。: 上課的時候，老師教我們數字的族語。

sisili cam sinsi’ masipul, tusauc cam sipulun tu sintusauc.
We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我們跟著老師唸，我們唱了數字歌。

uqancepan cak madia malasbunun.
I have learned many Bunun languages.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我學會好多族語。

daqdaqqanin cak munkaku’, daqdaqqanin cak pinanam malasbunun, patan’a zaku tina nak.
I go to school every day, I learn the Bunun language every day, and I want to tell my mother.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我天天去學校，我天天學族語，我要講給媽媽聽。

halacan cak tingmut munhan kaku’.
I was late for school this morning.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我早上上學遲到了。

minpungul cak madas kavang, munhan kaku’.
When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.
我的名字是Tiang。: 去學校的時候，我忘了帶書包。

uka’ nak inadas mazmaz.
I didn't bring anything with me.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我什麼東西都沒有帶。

muskun cak uskunan sadu, hung tu isnava’an.
During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.
我的名字是Tiang。: 上課的時候，我和同學一起看課本。

matu siking nga, simul cak han uskunan inpicu’ cin isqeqesqes.
During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.
我的名字是Tiang。: 考試的時候，同學借我筆和橡皮擦。

tupa’un cak sinsi’ tu, “matingmut minoqu, ka’in tu moqnang halacan!”
The teacher told me, Wake up earlier next time and don't be late again!""
我的名字是Tiang。: 老師跟我說：「下次早點起床，不要再遲到了!」

Tiang nga kaviaz nak, uva’az amin aipa Bunun.
My good friend’s name is Tiang, and he is also an Bunun child.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我的好朋友叫Tiang，他也布農族的小孩。

muskun cam ihan Malavi’ tu acang masipul.
We study together in the Malavi’ tribe.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我們一起在潭南部落讀書。

lucbut cam muskun tan’a madadengaz taqu paliqabasan, amin cam maqanciap malasBunun.
We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the Bunun proficiently.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我們常常一起聽耆老說故事，我們都很會說布農語。

madaqvas cak ka masboq, maqa Tiang nga maputis sa makuis.
I am tall and overweight, while Tiang is short and thin.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我很高也很胖，Tiang很矮也很瘦。

makackac ca Tiang nga, amin cam asa cia.
Tiang is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.
我的名字是Tiang。: Taing很有活力，大家都很喜歡他。

pintataiv haip pa kaku’, madia’ ’a unpintatauv.
Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.
我的名字是Tiang。: 今天是學校的運動會，學校舉辦了許多競賽。

heza’ pasibutbut, katundaq mali’, tindangkul, uluzi’, manaq buculkahkah.
There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.
我的名字是Tiang。: 有拔河、足球、跑步、跳舞和射箭。

minhamu cak patindangkul.
I participated in the running competition.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我比賽跑步。

matu tindangkul cak ka, mutingkul la, qedangun na qa’.
When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.
我的名字是Tiang。: 當我跑步的時候，我跌倒了，膝蓋流血了。

qala mindangkaz cak, moqnang tindangkul.
But I stood up and continued running forward.
我的名字是Tiang。: 但我站起來，繼續向前跑。

matu ka’ita’in cak ka amin na bunun manaskal.
Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我到終點時所有人都很開心。

qal tu ni tu lavai’ ’a, manaskal cak, opa sokanaqtung cak pintataiv.
Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.
我的名字是Tiang。: 雖然沒有獲得第一名，但我很高興，因為我完成了比賽。

dusa’ cak tama takna tantungu han tamaSai’.
Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.
我的名字是Tiang。: 昨天我和爸爸去拜訪我的Sai叔叔。

milu’lu’ cai tamaSai’ ’a bantac.
My uncle injured his foot.
我的名字是Tiang。: Sai'叔叔的腳受傷了。

taqu’an cam cia tu, “mutuszoq qa tatavi ka.”
He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.
我的名字是Tiang。: 他告訴我們，房子的屋頂破了一個洞。

matu matas’i naip tatavi ka, minihan daza’ tatavi muqalqal.
He fell off the roof while repairing it.
我的名字是Tiang。: 他在修理屋頂時，從屋頂摔下來了。

madas sa tama ki titi’qanvang cin pinung ispaska’ ’i tamaSai’.
My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.
我的名字是Tiang。: 爸爸帶了牛肉和檳榔給Sai'叔叔。

dusa’ cak ki tamaSai’ ihan palan pababazbaz, madia’ cia ka sintaqu paliqabasan.
My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我和叔叔在房間裡聊天，他分享了很多故事。

matu namudanin cak ka, tupa ka tamaSai’ tu taldaqvasin cak ka mintalmindukin."
Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我要離開前，Sai叔叔誇我長高了，也變得更帥氣了。

tupa cak tu, “maca mincialin na bantac ci tamaSai’ ’a, tantungu han lumaq nam.”
I said, When your foot gets better
我的名字是Tiang。: come to our house next time and visit us.""
https://web.klokah.tw/text/sound/34817/5: 我說：「等Sai'叔叔腳好了，下次也來我們家玩。」

ihan 2022 qamisan, palaqanciap pa Sehu’ tu maqa takisilaza tu niuvunsiu’ ’a maqtu kopa’un nganBunun mapatas.
In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.
我的名字是Tiang。: 在2022年，政府召開了原住民身分證可單列族名的會議。

macingav cak ki malbuntu tupa ki Sehu’ tu, “kopa’un nganBunun mapatas” han niuvunsiu’, talmindu tu Tiang tasikavan.
I interviewed Tiang tasikavan, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我訪問了長期向政府爭取身分證「單列族名」的部落青年Tiang tasikavan。

patupakin cak cia tu namaca pal’u’un namunhan cak lumaq cia macingav.
We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.
我的名字是Tiang。: 我和他約定好這個假日到他家訪問他。

matu ihan pacingav va, taqu’an cak cia tu mini’icaqa ngan cia, adasun cak cia pasaqal li tastulumaq cia cin acang cia.
During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.
我的名字是Tiang。: 在訪問的過程中，他向我介紹了他的名字的由來，也帶我認識了他的家人、他的部落。

cingavan zaku naip tu makua cuna asa’un na ngan mahuvaiv, niqa macial la sinpatas qabas?
I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn’t the old registration method sufficient?
我的名字是Tiang。: 我問他為什麼堅持要改名，舊的登記方式不好嗎?

tupa naip zaku tu, “opa maqa malastolu ka ni tu maqtu tupa ki anakanak tu ngan tulivaun ni bunun luklac tu Ti sinsi’ isqaqenanin aipi.
He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him \Di Xian Sheng
我的名字是Tiang。: \" which resulted in many jokes being made."
https://web.klokah.tw/text/sound/34817/5: 他對我說，因為用中文字並不能準確的傳達他的名字，其他人還會叫他「迪先生」，也因此鬧出不少笑話。

tupa ka Tiang tasikavan tu, “maqa mamantu tu ngan na cia kuci’an malasBunun mapatas, maqa ngan na pasqal li sidoq cin tastulumaq, maqtu’ang nga Bunun mucoqes kilim mi ngan mapatas.”
Tiang tasikavan said, \The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group
我的名字是Tiang。: our family
https://web.klokah.tw/text/sound/34817/5: our identity. I hope more fellow tribespeople can reclaim their own names.\""
column5: Tiang tasikavan說：「原住民語書寫的名字才是我們真正的名字。我的名字代表了我們的族群、我們的家族、我們的身分，希望能有更多族人找回自己的名字。」

malavi cak takna qudasno’az muhan unapukan babalivan, madas sa qudasno’az madia’ sincuaz cia sanglav, matas’i amin itucia Bunun tu kokonun iscav bunun.
Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.
我的名字是Tiang。: 昨天我跟奶奶去市集擺攤，奶奶帶了許多自己種的蔬菜去，也製作了原住民美食給大家。

amin na bunun asa ki babalivan ni qudasno’az, madia’ bunun mabaliv daqput cin daqputpa’ic, madia’ bunun minsuma tanam ma’un sinhanat cia sanglav.
Everyone loved my grandmother’s stall. Many people bought the chilis and African eggplants, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.
我的名字是Tiang。: 大家很喜歡奶奶的攤位，辣椒和車輪茄很多人買，許多人來品嘗她煮的菜餚。

macial konun na sinhanat cia li’li’ cin qesing dulaz, hezang vanis hibulan maqav sinhanat tu titi’, madia’ bunun hancuman, masan tidelaz han babalivan nam.
The ferns and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.
我的名字是Tiang。: 她煮的蕨菜和糯米飯非常好吃，還有用山豬肉煮的馬告滷肉，味道吸引了很多客人，大家都來我們攤位排隊。

mahanat ta qudasno’az zi kokonun na, ihan cak ngalan luluklac ci bunun, pidengun zaku luklac tu, “anak’anak ka sanglav sincuaz, ni tu cinulan iu’ tel’anak tal’ia tu sanglav, kava muhan di mabaliv!”
While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, \The vegetables are self-grown
我的名字是Tiang。: all-natural and organic! Come and buy now!\""
https://web.klokah.tw/text/sound/34817/5: 奶奶煮東西的時候，我在旁邊招攬客人。我在一旁大喊著：「蔬菜都是自己種的，天然有機，趕快來買喔!」

mahiav nam ma isbabaliv aminun mabaliv, tupa ka qudasno’az tu, “opa heza’ asu kadangaz za.”
Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, \It’s all thanks to your help.\""
我的名字是Tiang。: 我們的東西很快就賣完了，奶奶說：「都是因為有你的幫忙。」

minihan sinkukuza di, uqancepan cak itucia bunun ismut cin kokonun tu qanciap, musu tu uqancepan ni icia babalivan tu ineqdi’an.
Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.
我的名字是Tiang。: 這個活動，我學到了有關原住民植物和食品的知識，並且體驗到了擺攤的辛苦。

sadu ki qudasno’an malkacia itubunun kokonun tu qanciap, mastan cak matumaceqeng unaskalan.
Seeing my grandmother’s passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.
我的名字是Tiang。: 看到了奶奶對傳統食物的熱愛，我感到非常尊敬和榮幸。
